programme.title: Newcastle United vs. Chelsea - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Newcastle have won their last three Premier League home games against Chelsea, last winning more consecutively against them at St James’ Park between 1994 and 1998. Chelsea lost 2-0 at Newcastle in their last Premier League game against them but haven’t failed to score in consecutive league meetings with the Magpies since February 1933.

programme.title: Tottenham Hotspur vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Tottenham have won just two of their last 25 Premier League games against Liverpool, picking up home wins in October 2017 and September 2023. Liverpool won both Premier League meetings with Spurs last season by 6-3 and 5-1 scorelines. Only the Reds themselves have scored 5+ goals in three consecutive games against an opponent in the competition, doing so against Norwich between September 2012 and December 2013.

programme.title: Aston Villa vs. Manchester United - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Aston Villa have won just one of their last 26 Premier League home games against Manchester United, beating them 3-1 in November 2022 in Unai Emery’s first match in charge. Manchester United have won 41 Premier League games against Aston Villa, with 18 of those coming away from home. Only the Red Devils themselves have beaten an opponent more both overall and on the road.

programme.title: Manchester United vs. Newcastle United - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Manchester United have lost four of their last five Premier League games against Newcastle, as many as they had in their previous 38 against the Magpies. Newcastle did the league double over Manchester United last season, including a 2-0 win in this exact fixture. They’ve not won consecutive visits to Old Trafford since March 1935, while they last won three in a row against the Red Devils in January 1922.

programme.title: Real Betis vs Getafe - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Athletic Club are unbeaten in their last ten LaLiga matches against Getafe, their longest undefeated run against them in the competition. Getafe have drawn more LaLiga matches and more away LaLiga matches against Athletic Club than against any other opponent.

programme.title: Athletic Bilbao vs Espanyol - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Mallorca have won 75% of their home games against Levante in LaLiga, only against Rayo Vallecano do they have a higher win percentage than against the Granotas in the competition among all their rivals with at least five home games. Following their last win in January 2022, Levante can win back-to-back matches against Mallorca for the second time in their LaLiga history, having previously achieved this in their first two clashes in 2004 and 2005.

programme.title: Levante vs Real Sociedad - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Real Madrid have won seven of their last 11 LaLiga clashes with Barcelona, achieving the same number of victories as in their previous 29 ElClásico meetings in the competition. FC Barcelona have won their last four matches against Real Madrid in all competitions and have the chance to achieve five consecutive victories for the second time in the history of El Clásico, following those achieved between 2008 and 2010 under Josep Guardiola.

programme.title: Osasuna vs Deportivo Alaves - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Real Betis have picked up points in four of their last seven home games against Atletico de Madrid in LaLiga, having lost seven of their previous nine home games against the Rojiblancos in the competition. Atletico de Madrid have failed to win in either of their last two LaLiga away games at the Benito Villamarín, failing to score in both. Atletico Madrid have never gone three consecutive away games without scoring against the Verdiblancos in the top flight.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Sevilla - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Espanyol have only won one of their last six LaLiga games against Elche, the last of which was a 1-0 win in February 2023, and have not won two consecutive games against them in the competition since March 1985. After five consecutive home wins against Elche in LaLiga between 1975 and 1984, Espanyol have won just one of their subsequent five league matches against them at home, failing to win any of the last three.

programme.title: Girona vs Atletico Madrid - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Valencia have not won any of their last three LaLiga matches against Villarreal, drawing the last two. Never in the history of the competition have Valencia drawn three consecutive matches against the Yellows. Villarreal have won 21 of their 50 LaLiga matches against Valencia ; they have only recorded as many top-flight victories against Getafe CF.

programme.title: Villarreal vs Barcelona - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Real Sociedad have lost two of their last three LaLiga matches against Sevilla, after having not lost any of their previous five against the Sevillians in the competition. Sevilla have lost two of their last three visits to Real Sociedad in LaLiga, although their last away league win against them came in March 2025. They have not won two consecutive away LaLiga matches against Real Sociedad since 2011.

programme.title: Elche vs Rayo Vallecan - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: This will be the first meeting between Girona and Real Oviedo in LaLiga. In all competitions, the Catalan side has not lost any of its last five matches against the Oviedo side, all of them in LaLiga Hypermotion. Real Oviedo have failed to win on any of their eight visits to Girona in all competitions, losing on each of their last two trips to Estadi Municipal de Montilivi.

programme.title: Real Betis vs Getafe - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Athletic Club are unbeaten in their last ten LaLiga matches against Getafe, their longest undefeated run against them in the competition. Getafe have drawn more LaLiga matches and more away LaLiga matches against Athletic Club than against any other opponent.

programme.title: Valencia vs Mallorca - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Rayo Vallecano have won their last two LaLiga matches against Deportivo Alaves, keeping a clean sheet in both, and can claim three consecutive wins against the Vitoria-born side for the first time in their history in the competition. Alaves, with Abelardo Fernández as coach, won 5-1 against Rayo Vallecano in September 2018, the only time the Vitoria-born side has scored five goals in an away match in its entire top-flight history.

programme.title: Real Oviedo vs Celta Vigo - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Osasuna have lost two of their last three LaLiga matches against Celta de Vigo, the same number of defeats as in their previous nine top-flight matches. programme.title: Valencia vs Mallorca - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Rayo Vallecano have won their last two LaLiga matches against Deportivo Alaves, keeping a clean sheet in both, and can claim three consecutive wins against the Vitoria-born side for the first time in their history in the competition. programme.title: Osasuna vs Deportivo Alaves - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17

programme.title: Katerina Siniakova / Taylor Townsend vs Gabriela Dabrowski / Erin Routliffe - Womens Doubles Final
programme.desc: Arthur Ashe Court - Tennis US Open 2025

programme.title: Holger RUNE (DEN) vs Jack DRAPER (GBR) - Final BNP Paribas Open - presentado por HSBC 2025 - TENNIS
programme.desc: Holger Rune (DEN) meets Jack Draper (GBR) in the 2025 BNP Paribas Open final, the first ATP Masters 1000 title match between two players born in the 2000s. Rune defeated Daniil Medvedev in the semis with sharp tactics, while Draper edged past Carlos Alcaraz, displaying power and resilience. Rune leads their head-to-head 1-0, having won their 2024 Cincinnati clash in straight sets.

programme.title: Jakub Mensik (CZE) vs Novak Djokovic (SRB) - Final - Miami Open 2025 - presented by Itaú - ATP 1000
programme.desc: 19-year-old Mensik, the Czech phenom, blasts into his first Masters final—taking down Top 10 giants with missile serves and fearless power. One win from history as youngest Miami champ ever.Across the net: Djokovic. The old lion prowls for his 7th Miami throne—still devouring dreamers.Tonight, fire meets fortress. The future charges at forever.

programme.title: Lorenzo MUSETTI (ITA) vs Carlos ALCARAZ (ESP) - Final Rolex Monte Carlo Masters - ATP 1000 - Monaco
programme.desc: In the 2025 Monte Carlo Masters final, No. 2 seed Carlos Alcaraz meets Lorenzo Musetti in a high-stakes clay-court clash. Alcaraz, chasing his first Monte Carlo title, reached his seventh Masters 1000 final after defeating Davidovich Fokina. Musetti, now the third Italian to reach this final in the Open Era, earned his spot by edging past Alex de Minaur. Alcaraz leads their head-to-head 3–1, with Musetti’s lone win coming on clay in Hamburg (2022).

programme.title: Casper Ruud (NOR) vs Jack Draper (GBR) - Final - Mutua Madrid Open 2025 - ATP 1000
programme.desc: In a first-ever ATP Tour meeting, clay-court specialist Casper Ruud takes on rising British star Jack Draper in the 2025 Madrid final. Ruud, a two-time Grand Slam finalist, is seeking his first Masters 1000 title. Draper, who claimed his breakthrough Masters win in Indian Wells earlier this season, aims to secure a second major trophy in 2025. A compelling battle awaits on the Caja Mágica clay.

programme.title: AO Originals - Ambition
programme.desc: AMBITION is the story of tennis’ fearless new breed rewriting the rules on the sport’s biggest stage - with Alcaraz, Sinner, Gauff, Swiatek and a wave of hungry young challengers reshaping the game with raw talent and audacious self-belief

programme.title: Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) - Cincinnati Open 2025 - ATP 1000
programme.desc: World No. 1 Jannik Sinner, holder of four Masters 1000 titles and 20 ATP singles trophies, comes into the Cincinnati final after winning two titles this season, including the Australian Open and Wimbledon. Across the net stands Carlos Alcaraz, with seven Masters crowns, 21 career titles, and five tournament victories already in 2025. Their rivalry remains one of the sport’s most exciting, with Alcaraz leading the head-to-head 8–5.

programme.title: Valentin Vacherot (MON) vs Arthur Rinderknech (FRA) - Final - Rolex Shanghai Masters ATP 1000
programme.desc: Valentin Vacherot (MON) vs Arthur Rinderknech (FRA). First cousins meet in a historic Masters final after shock runs—qualifier Vacherot beat Djokovic; Rinderknech upset Medvedev to reach his first Masters title match. A family affair with big serves and fearless baseline hitting—expect tight sets and high drama in Shanghai.

programme.title: Felix AUGER-ALIASSIME (CAN) vs Jannik SINNER (ITA) - Final - Rolex Paris Masters - Paris - 2025
programme.desc: The 2025 Rolex Paris Masters will be held from 27 October to 2 November at the new Paris La Defense Arena. Now in its 54th edition, this ATP Masters 1000 tournament features the world’s top players battling on indoor hard courts in both singles and doubles draws. With total prize money of €6,128,940, the event serves as the final major stop before the ATP Finals, promising a thrilling conclusion to the tennis season.

programme.title: AO Originals - Ambition
programme.desc: AMBITION is the story of tennis’ fearless new breed rewriting the rules on the sport’s biggest stage - with Alcaraz, Sinner, Gauff, Swiatek and a wave of hungry young challengers reshaping the game with raw talent and audacious self-belief

programme.title: Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs Alexander Zverev (GER) -Mens Singles Final - Road Laver Arena - Australian O
programme.desc: The 2025 Australian Open men’s singles final sees defending champion and World No. 1 Jannik Sinner taking on World No. 2 Alexander Zverev. Sinner chases his third Grand Slam title after dominating Ben Shelton in the semifinals. Zverev, still in search of his first Grand Slam title, advanced after Novak Djokovic retired due to injury. A thrilling battle unfolds, with Sinner’s aggressive play clashing against Zverev’s powerful serves and groundstrokes.

programme.title: Aryna Sabalenka vs Madison Keys (USA) - Womens Singles Final - Road Laver Arena - Australian Open
programme.desc: Aryna Sabalenka faces Madison Keys in the Australian Open women’s singles final. Sabalenka, the World No. 1, dominates their head-to-head 4-1 and looks unstoppable on Rod Laver Arena, riding a 20-match winning streak. Keys, ranked 19th, delivers a stunning run, defeating top seeds, including Iga Swiatek, with improved form under her husband-coach Bjorn Fratangelo. A clash of power and precision unfolds as they battle for the title.

programme.title: S. Bolelli (ITA) / A. Vavassori (ITA) vs H. Heliovaara (FIN) / H. Patten (GBR) - Mens Doubles Fin
programme.desc: In the 2025 Australian Open men’s doubles final, the Italian duo Simone Bolelli and Andrea Vavassori faces Harri Heliovaara and Henry Patten. Bolelli and Vavassori showcase their exceptional teamwork, while Heliovaara and Patten bring momentum from a hard-fought semifinal victory over Kevin Krawietz and Tim Putz. The match delivers a thrilling contest between two in-form teams battling for the prestigious title.

programme.title: K. Siniakova (CZE) / T. Townsend (USA) vs S. Hsieh (TPE) / J. Ostapenko (LAT) -Womens Doubles Fina
programme.desc: The 2025 Australian Open women’s doubles final features top seeds Kateřina Siniaková and Taylor Townsend against third seeds Hsieh Su-wei and Jeļena Ostapenko. Siniaková and Townsend, fresh off their Wimbledon triumph, aim for another Grand Slam title. Hsieh and Ostapenko, despite being a relatively new pairing, have impressed with their strong chemistry, including a hard-fought semifinal win over Gabriela Dabrowski and Erin Routliffe. A thrilling battle between two exceptional teams unfolds.

programme.title: AO Originals - Ambition
programme.desc: AMBITION is the story of tennis’ fearless new breed rewriting the rules on the sport’s biggest stage - with Alcaraz, Sinner, Gauff, Swiatek and a wave of hungry young challengers reshaping the game with raw talent and audacious self-belief

programme.title: Jannik SINNER (ITA) vs Carlos ALCARAZ (ESP) - Mens Singles - Finals - Philippe-Chatrier Court - R
programme.desc: Defending champion Carlos Alcaraz faces World No. 1 Jannik Sinner in a highly anticipated final. Alcaraz aims to retain his title, while Sinner seeks his first Roland-Garros crown. Both players have showcased exceptional form throughout the tournament, setting the stage for a thrilling championship match.

programme.title: Aryna SABALENKA vs Coco GAUFF (USA) - Womens Singles - Finals - Philippe-Chatrier Court - Roland G
programme.desc: World No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka takes on World No. 2 Coco Gauff in a blockbuster Roland-Garros final. With their head-to-head tied at 5–5, and both players chasing their first Roland-Garros crown, this rivalry reaches a new peak on the Paris clay. A Grand Slam classic in the making.

programme.title: Marcel GRANOLLERS (ESP) / Horacio ZEBALLOS (ARG) vs Joe SALISBURY (GBR)/Neal SKUPSKI (GBR) - Mens
programme.desc: Fifth seeds Marcel Granollers and Horacio Zeballos face eighth seeds Joe Salisbury and Neal Skupski in a high-stakes final. Granollers and Zeballos, seeking their first Grand Slam title together after three previous final appearances, take on the British duo, who aim to become the first all-British team to win the Roland-Garros mens doubles since 1936. A compelling clash of experience and ambition on the Paris clay.

programme.title: Anna DANILINA (KAZ) Aleksandra KRUNIC (SRB) vs Sara ERRANI (ITA) Jasmine PAOLINI (ITA) - Womens Dou
programme.desc: Second seeds Sara Errani and Jasmine Paolini take on Anna Danilina and Aleksandra Krunić in the womens doubles final. Errani and Paolini, finalists for the second consecutive year, aim to secure their first Roland-Garros title as a team against the unseeded duo of Danilina and Krunić

programme.title: Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) - Gentlemen’s Singles Final - Centre Court - Wimbledon 2
programme.desc: Top seed Jannik Sinner takes on defending champion Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster Wimbledon final. This is their fifth career meeting, with Alcaraz leading the head-to-head 3–1. Sinner is chasing his first Wimbledon crown, while Alcaraz aims for a historic third straight title. A generational battle on Centre Court.

programme.title: Amanda Anisimova (USA) vs Iga Swiatek (POL) - Ladies’ Singles Final - Centre Court - Wimbledon 2025
programme.desc: A first-time Wimbledon champion will be crowned as Iga Świątek faces Amanda Anisimova. Świątek, a five-time Grand Slam winner, reaches her first final at SW19. Anisimova, playing her maiden major final, stunned world No. 1 Sabalenka in the semis. This is their first-ever meeting. Experience vs momentum — who will triumph on Centre Court?

programme.title: One Friday Fight 2025 - 137
programme.desc: ONE Friday Fights 137ONE closes 2025 with a stacked card at Lumpinee Stadium on December 19. Featherweight Muay Thai World Champion Tawanchai returns to kickboxing against the dangerous “Spirit Dragon” Liu Mengyang. The card also features Sam-A vs Jaosuayai, Yod-IQ vs Elbrus Osmanov, Suablack vs Pakorn, Jo Nattawut vs Mohammad Siasarani, Zhang Peimian vs Thongpoon, and more action-packed bouts.

programme.title: Nants vs Paris - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Team – Round 1 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The GCL Team Round 1 opens the Rome leg at the Foro Italico. Two riders per squad chase fast, fault-free trips to set the overnight order and carry scores into Round 2. Expect tight time allowed, flowing lines, and smart tactics on stride counts and anchor placement as title contenders push for pole.

programme.title: Team - Round 2 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The decisive GCL Team Round 2. Reverse-order start from Round 1, with every rail and second counting toward the combined team total. Strategic rider swaps and cool heads over a technical track shape the podium and precious championship points in a high-stakes Roman finish.

programme.title: CSI5 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: Top combinations tackle elite CSI5* classes at the Foro Italico. A technical track, tight time allowed and related lines test precision and power, with the fastest clears advancing to a jump-off. Expect fine margins, inside turns and bold strides as riders chase ranking points and momentum for the Grand Prix.

programme.title: Grand Prix of Rome - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The 1.60m LGCT Grand Prix: one round plus jump-off for big championship points and a golden ticket to the Prague Playoffs Super Grand Prix. Huge oxers, delicate verticals and a demanding time allowed reward brave riding and perfect stride control in a high-stakes Roman finale.

programme.title: T100 Triathlon - PTO - World Tour 2025 Final - Doha
programme.desc: The T100 Triathlon World Tour Final lands in Doha/Lusail (10–13 December 2025) as the season-ending showdown that crowns the T100 World Champion. Featuring the world-class professional field, the race is contested over the T100 format (2km swim, 80km bike, 18km run) on a course set around Doha and Lusail, with the decisive pro race scheduled for 12 December 2025 (09:45 AST) in Qatar.

programme.title: Day 2 - Grand Slam Track 2025

programme.title: Day 3 - Grand Slam Track 2025
programme.desc: The final day in Kingston features decisive races, including the womens 100m hurdles, mens 400m hurdles, and mens 800m. Athletes compete for crucial points, with champions crowned in each category. The days events highlight emerging talents and set the stage for the season ahead

programme.title: Team – Round 1 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The GCL Team Round 1 opens the Rome leg at the Foro Italico. Two riders per squad chase fast, fault-free trips to set the overnight order and carry scores into Round 2. programme.title: Team - Round 2 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The decisive GCL Team Round 2. Reverse-order start from Round 1, with every rail and second counting toward the combined team total. Strategic rider swaps and cool heads over a technical track shape the podium and precious championship points in a high-stakes Roman finish.

programme.title: CSI5 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: Top combinations tackle elite CSI5* classes at the Foro Italico. Expect fine margins, inside turns and bold strides as riders chase ranking points and momentum for the Grand Prix.

programme.title: Grand Prix of Rome - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The 1.60m LGCT Grand Prix: one round plus jump-off for big championship points and a golden ticket to the Prague Playoffs Super Grand Prix. Huge oxers, delicate verticals and a demanding time allowed reward brave riding and perfect stride control in a high-stakes Roman finale.

programme.desc: The T100 Triathlon World Tour Final lands in Doha/Lusail (10–13 December 2025) as the season-ending showdown that crowns the T100 World Champion. programme.title: Nants vs Paris - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue

Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Algeria vs Sudan - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the first ever AFCON encounter between Algeria and Sudan. Sudan are unbeaten in their last two games against Algeria in all competitions, winning on penalties in the quarter finals of the African Nations Championship in August and a 0-0 draw in the FIFA Arab Cup earlier this month. Algeria are making their 21st appearance at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. They will be attempting to win the trophy for the third time, after 1990 and 2019 – both previous victories were won on North African soil: at home in 1990 and in Egypt in 2019.

programme.title: Cameroon vs Gabon - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the third AFCON encounter between Cameroon and Gabon. The two previous meetings produced only one goal, with Gabon winning 1-0 in 2010 before a goalless draw in 2017. Only against Guinea have Cameroon played more matches at AFCON without ending up on the winning side. The last time Cameroon lost their opening match at an AFCON was in 2010 – against Gabon.

programme.desc: The 35th edition of the Africa Cup of Nations will take place in Morocco from the 21st of December 2025 through until 18th January 2026. All matches from AFCON are live and exclusive only on beIN.

programme.title: Evening Show - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: Every evening, following the last game of the day, the AFCON Evening Show will review the day’s action and preview the upcoming matches and talking points from Morocco. All matches from AFCON are live and exclusive only on beIN

programme.title: Morocco vs Comoros - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the second meeting between Morocco and Comoros at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Their only previous encounter produced a 2-0 Morocco victory, in the group stages in January 2022. This is Comoros’ second appearance at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Their inaugural participation was in 2022 – they lost three of their four matches but nevertheless reached the round of 16 where they were knocked out by hosts Cameroon.

programme.title: Evening Show - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: Every evening, following the last game of the day, the AFCON Evening Show will review the day’s action and preview the upcoming matches and talking points from Morocco. All matches from AFCON are live and exclusive only on beIN

programme.title: Burkina faso vs Equatorial Guinea - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the second AFCON encounter between Burkina Faso and Equatorial Guinea. Their only previous meeting was in the 2015 group stages – it ended goalless. In fact, both of their last two encounters haven’t produced a single goal: the 2015 AFCON match and a friendly in 2023. This is Burkina Faso’s 14th appearance in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Their best performance to date was in 2013 when they reached the final for the first and so far only time in the country’s history – they lost 1-0 against Nigeria, in South Africa.

programme.title: Egypt vs South Africa - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the fourth encounter between Egypt and South Africa at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. programme.title: Burkina faso vs Equatorial Guinea - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the second AFCON encounter between Burkina Faso and Equatorial Guinea. Their only previous meeting was in the 2015 group stages – it ended goalless. In fact, both of their last two encounters haven’t produced a single goal: the 2015 AFCON match and a friendly in 2023. This is Burkina Faso’s 14th appearance in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Their best performance to date was in 2013 when they reached the final for the first and so far only time in the country’s history – they lost 1-0 against Nigeria, in South Africa.

They will be attempting to win the trophy for the fourth time, after 1992, 2015 and 2024.

programme.title: Tunisia vs Uganda - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the third encounter between Tunisia and Uganda at AFCON, but also their first meeting in the tournament for 47 years. Tunisia won both of their previous matches, scoring six goals and conceding only one. This is Tunisia’s 22nd participation in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations, and their 17th in a row, the latter being a record in the history of the tournament. Their only AFCON title dates back to 2004, as hosts; since then, they’ve progressed past the quarter-finals only once, in 2019, losing in the third-place match.

programme.title: Angola vs Zimbabwe - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the first meeting between Angola and Zimbabwe in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Angola and Zimbabwe’s last competitive encounter was in a couple of Africa Cup of Nations final qualifiers, in 2012. Angola qualified on the away goals rule, after losing 3-1 in Zimbabwe and winning 2-0 at home.

programme.title: Egypt vs South Africa - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the fourth encounter between Egypt and South Africa at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Egypt won the first two – a group game in 1996 and the final in 1998 – while South Africa came out on top in their last meeting in 2019. Egypt’s last victory against South Africa was in November 2006, a friendly played in London. Since then, they have drawn two and lost four of their meetings with Bafana Bafana.

programme.title: Zambia vs Comrores - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the first meeting between Zambia and Comoros in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Zambia haven’t won their second match at any of their 10 last CAF Africa Cup of Nations tournaments, since winning 5-1 against Burkina Faso at the 1996 edition.

programme.title: Morocco vs Mali - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: Morocco and Mali’s only previous encounter in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations came in the semi-finals of the 2004 edition – Morocco won 4-0. Morocco haven’t lost their second group match in any of their last five CAF Africa Cup of Nations tournaments, since suffering a 3-2 defeat to Gabon in the 2012 edition.

programme.desc: The 2025 Africa Cup of Nations, commonly known as AFCON 2025, marks the 35th edition of this prestigious biennial tournament organized by the Confederation of African Football (CAF). programme.title: Morocco vs UAE - Semi-Finals - Fifa Arab cup 2025
programme.desc: The 2025 FIFA Arab Cup takes place in Qatar from 1st to 18th December 2025.Every game will be live on beIN.This is the third time that Qatar will host the FIFA Arab Cup following the 1998 and 2021 editions. Algeria are the defending champions.

programme.title: KSA vs Jordan - Semi-Finals - Fifa Arab cup 2025
programme.desc: The 2025 FIFA Arab Cup takes place in Qatar from 1st to 18th December 2025.Every game will be live on beIN.This is the third time that Qatar will host the FIFA Arab Cup following the 1998 and 2021 editions. Algeria are the defending champions.

programme.title: Jordan vs Morocco - Final - Fifa Arab cup 2025
programme.desc: Jordan and Morocco go head-to-head for the right to be crowned FIFA Arab Cup 2025 champions.This is Jordan’s second successive major final after finishing runners up in the AFC Asian Cup Final 2024.FIFA World Cup 2022 semi-finalists, Morocco, will start as favourites. Both nations have qualified for the FIFA World Cup 2026.The match is live from a sold-out Lusail Stadium, Doha, Qatar.

programme.title: Day 3 - Qatar Prix de l’Arc de Triomphe 2025
programme.desc: The Qatar Prix de l’Arc de Triomphe 2025 is Europe’s flagship Group 1 flat race, staged at Paris Longchamp over 2,400m (about 1m 4f) for elite three-year-olds and up. Run on turf at the heart of Arc weekend, it’s a pure championship test of pace, position, and stamina, drawing the season’s best middle-distance talent with a total purse around €5 million.
